decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Reflector Mage, while also generating card advantage and tempo with cards like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Collected Company. Eldrazi Displacer provides disruption and flexibility, while Dromoka's Command and Ojutai's Command offer additional utility. The mana base supports the Bant color combination, allowing for consistent and smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan, aiming for a quick victory through aggressive plays.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with powerful creatures like Nissa, Voice of Zendikar and Sylvan Advocate, and using cards like Hangarback Walker and Archangel Avacyn to maintain board presence. It also includes removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Tragic Arrogance to deal with threats. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional creature support, while Dromoka's Command offers versatility. The deck's mana base is optimized with lands like Fortified Village and Canopy Vista to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors.

This deck focuses on quickly playing creatures to overwhelm opponents with a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful mid-range threats. The deck includes cards that allow you to quickly search for lands and cast spells with multiple colors, providing versatility and speed. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command, you can maintain control of the board while steadily building your army of creatures. The key strategy is to maintain a consistent flow of creatures while controlling the battlefield to push for a strong and aggressive victory.

The main idea behind this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with creatures and outpace the opponent in terms of board presence. By utilizing cards like Bounding Krasis, Reflector Mage, and Sylvan Advocate, the deck aims to control the board while also dealing damage to the opponent. Collected Company is a key card in this strategy, allowing the player to quickly search for more creatures to deploy. The addition of cards like Dromoka's Command and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy provide additional utility and flexibility to the deck's overall game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful synergy between creatures with disruptive abilities and spell cards to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. By efficiently casting spells and using the creatures' abilities to bounce, tap, and generate card advantage, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to the different colors needed for the deck's spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a strong board presence by playing low-cost creatures like Lambholt Pacifist and Thalia's Lieutenant. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Dromoka's Command. Collected Company allows the deck to dig for more creatures and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, cards like Tireless Tracker provide card advantage and help stabilize the board. The deck's mana base supports its three-color identity while also providing consistent access to its spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize green ramp cards to quickly accelerate mana production, allowing for the early casting of powerful creatures and spells. By ramping up quickly, the deck aims to control the battlefield with high-impact threats like World Breaker, Ulamog, and Dragonlord Atarka. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Chandra, Flamecaller for additional board control and card advantage. The focus on ramping and controlling the game state sets up the player for a strong mid to late game where they can dominate their opponent with massive threats.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Hangarback Walker, while supporting them with powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creature aggression and removal spells like Stasis Snare and Declaration in Stone, maintaining pressure throughout the game. The mana base is optimized to support the color requirements of the spells and ensure consistent plays.

The Bant Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful buffs. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Reflector Mage to boost the team's strength and disrupt the opponent's strategy, combined with cards like Dromoka's Command and Collected Company for additional support and versatility, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control the game tempo. With a mix of creatures and spells that provide both offense and defense, the Bant Aggro deck offers a well-rounded and adaptable strategy for victory.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence of creatures, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Collected Company to pump up and bring out creatures quickly. Reflector Mage allows for tempo plays by bouncing opponent's creatures back to hand, while Archangel Avacyn provides protection and a board wipe effect if needed. Dromoka's Command gives additional removal and pump effects, while Tireless Tracker provides card advantage. The mana base is composed of lands that can produce all required colors.

The main concept of this deck is to use green ramping spells like Nissa's Pilgrimage and Explosive Vegetation to quickly build up mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Dragonlord Atarka. The deck also utilizes control elements like Chandra, Flamecaller and Kozilek's Return to manage the board and control the pace of the game. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while also having the ability to control the game through removal and board wipes.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures. By ramping up mana with Hedron Archive and Shrine of the Forsaken Gods, the deck aims to play big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Drowner of Hope. Additionally, cards like Spatial Contortion and Clash of Wills help control the board early on, while Chandra, Flamecaller and Jace, Unraveler of Secrets provide additional card advantage and board control. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient use of resources and powerful late-game threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and powerful creatures. By using cards like Ultimate Price, Grasp of Darkness, and Radiant Flames to remove threats, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan. It also utilizes hand disruption with Transgress the Mind and card draw with Painful Truths and Read the Bones to maintain card advantage. The deck's win condition comes from powerful creatures like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Goblin Dark-Dwellers, backed up by planeswalkers like Chandra, Flamecaller for additional value.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Gideon, as well as resilient creatures like Archangel Avacyn and Hangarback Walker, the deck aims to apply pressure early and often. The inclusion of cards like Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone provide additional removal and disruption options, while cards like Secure the Wastes and Westvale Abbey can help close out games quickly. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of tempo and board control.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and planeswalkers that can quickly take control of the battlefield. By playing aggressively and utilizing cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Archangel Avacyn, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and secure victories through fast and efficient combat strategies. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone allows for removal and disruption to further support the aggressive playstyle of the deck.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive strategy using low-cost white creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Anointer of Champions, Dragon Hunter, and Expedition Envoy, the deck aims to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Always Watching help to pump up the creatures and make them more threatening. Declaration in Stone provides removal for opposing threats, while Kytheon, Hero of Akros serves as a strong early game threat. The deck uses a combination of creatures and enchantments to maintain aggression and control the battlefield.
